com.lhings.library

Class LhingsError

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.lhings.library.LhingsError
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class LhingsError
extends java.lang.RuntimeException
    Thrown when an error in the communication with the Lhings platform is detected. The possible causes of this exceptiona are:
    • Unauthorized. The username and password combination provided was incorrect.
    • JSON error. The device sent some bad formatted json to the Lhings platform. This usually will mean a bug in the library. Please, report it to support@lhings.com.
    • Device deleted. The device was deleted from the Lhings platform and is no longer allowed to connect. Deleting the file UUID.txt will solve the issue.
    • Quota exceeded. You already have the maximum number of devices allowed in your account type. Upgrade your account if you want to add more devices.
    • Duplicated UUID. The device tried to register against the platform using an already existing UUID. Deleting the file UUID.txt will solve the issue.
    See Also:
